Comments_List: This course is excellent - after 1 semester of Indonesian, I now find myself thinking in Indonesian every now and then. The teaching style of this class facilitates learning and Indonesian 110 is the best language course I have ever taken.
I learned a lot of Indonesian vocabulary!
I learned elementary Indonesian as well as more about Indonesian culture and foods.
A basic knowledge of the Indonesian language.
Indonesian language and culture, colloquial communication

Amazing. This class is amazing. Not only is there a strong emphasis on learning the grammar and vocabulary, but we learned so much about the culture and the people which I thought was interesting and useful.
I was able to discover the culture and traditions of Indonesian people, as well as learn a fun, unique language.

Strengths:

There are many different teachers to work with, meaning that you will hear different accents and truly come to understand spoken Indonesian. 
The class is fun and this has made the class a better learning experience. I am always excited to go to Indonesian class and see the teachers.
Sometimes sentence structure is confusing, but I understand the vocabulary!
More clear instructions
It was always a fun and engaging class that managed to also cover a lot of material.
Learnt grammar, vocabulary in a well-structured manner. Perhaps use of online tools such as Canvas can be enhanced.

One of the weaknesses of this course was not enough vocab tests. Although it is a weird thing for a student to be requesting more tests, but I thought it would be useful to make sure we are keeping up with the knowledge that is expected out of us.
The course was organized well and it was fun to engage in.
Take this course, more Americans need to learn about Indonesia!
Yes, Indonesian is amazing and the professors are so helpful and awesome!
Yes
Yes love teacher
Yes, it is fascinating.
I would recommend this course because it not only gives you insight to the basics of the language of Indonesian, but you learn so much about the culture.
I would recommend this course to other students, especially students that want to try something new.
